intro: Astragalus brevivexillatus, commonly known as the short-stemmed milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the arid and semi-arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to drought conditions, showcasing a deep root system for water retention. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Astragalus brevivexillatus plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinators in its native habitat.
